info.title: Magware API
info.description:
![image](https://i.imgur.com/S8b6o7m.png)

# Magware API - Comprehensive WMS Integration

Magware API is a comprehensive REST-based web service designed for seamless integration between the Magware WMS (Warehouse Management System) and external Host systems. This API provides a standardized and robust interface for complete warehouse process management.

## üéØ Overview

The Magware API enables businesses to:
- **Synchronize items** between external systems and the WMS
- **Manage complete workflows** from inbound goods to outbound shipments, including adjustments
- **Monitor real-time status** of inventory and operations
- **Automate processes** for receiving, picking, and shipping

## üèóÔ∏è API Architecture

### Standardized REST Model
The API follows REST principles with:
- **Logically organized endpoints** by resource (items, deliveries, shipments, etc.)
- **Semantic HTTP methods** (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- **Standard HTTP status codes** to indicate operation results
- **JSON format** for all request and response payloads

### Authentication & Security
- **API Key** in `APIKey` header for authentication
- **Owner Code** in `owner` header for multi-tenant isolation
- **Strict validation** of all input data

## üìä Core Operational Flow

### 1. Item Management
```
Host System ‚Üí POST /items ‚Üí Magware WMS
           ‚Üê GET /items/{code} ‚Üê 
           ‚Üê PUT /items/{code} ‚Üê 
```

### 2. Receiving Process (ASN - Advanced Shipping Notice)
```
Host ‚Üí POST /asn ‚Üí Magware (Create ASN)
Host ‚Üê GET /asn/received ‚Üê Magware (List received ASNs)
Host ‚Üê GET /asn/received/{id} ‚Üê Magware (Receiving details)
```

### 3. Delivery Order Management
```
Host ‚Üí POST /deliveries ‚Üí Magware (New order)
Host ‚Üê GET /deliveries/prepared ‚Üê Magware (Prepared orders)
Host ‚Üê GET /deliveries/prepared/{id} ‚Üê Magware (Order details)
```

### 4. Shipment Tracking
```
Host ‚Üí POST /shipments ‚Üí Magware (New shipment)
Host ‚Üê GET /shipments ‚Üê Magware (Shipment list)
Host ‚Üê GET /shipments/{id} ‚Üê Magware (Shipment tracking)
```


## üîÑ Data Synchronization Mechanism

### Polling-Based Architecture
The Magware API implements a **polling-based synchronization model** specifically designed to minimize system overhead while ensuring reliable data consistency. This approach provides optimal performance for warehouse operations where real-time updates are balanced against system stability.

### "List ‚Üí Details" Pattern
To ensure efficient and reliable synchronization, the API implements a standardized "List ‚Üí Details" pattern:

#### Phase 1: Retrieve List
```http
GET /resource_type/status_filter
```
**Examples:**
```http
GET /deliveries/prepared
GET /asn/received
GET /deliveries/cancelled
```

**Response:**
```json
[
  12131237,
  43534534,
  77539764
]
```

#### Phase 2: Retrieve Details
For each ID received in the list:
```http
GET /resource_type/status_filter/{id}
```

**Example:**
```http
GET /deliveries/prepared/12131237
```

**Detailed response:**
```json
{
  "id": 12131237,
  "order_number": "ORD001",
  "status": "prepared",
  "items": [...],
  "shipping_address": {...},
  "tracking_info": {...}
}
```

#### Phase 3: Automatic State Management
After the Host system successfully retrieves the detailed data via the GET call, Magware automatically marks the record as "transmitted" and removes it from subsequent list responses. This ensures:

- **No duplicate processing**: Records are automatically excluded from future list calls once retrieved
- **Clean state management**: The list endpoint always returns only new/unprocessed items
- **Simplified integration**: No manual acknowledgment required from the Host system
- **Idempotent operations**: Repeated detail calls for the same ID remain safe and consistent

<!-- theme: warning -->
> **Important**: The detail retrieval (GET) call itself serves as the acknowledgment mechanism. Once you successfully fetch the details of a record, it will no longer appear in the list endpoint response.

<!-- theme: warning -->
> **Error handling**: If the detail call fails (network error, timeout, etc.), the record remains in the list and will be included in subsequent polling cycles, ensuring no data loss.
### Recommended Polling Frequency
- **List endpoints**: Poll every **5 minutes** for optimal balance between timeliness and system load
- **Detail endpoints**: Fetch immediately after receiving new IDs from list calls
- **High-priority resources**: Can be polled more frequently (minimum 1 minute intervals)

### Pattern Benefits

1. **Minimal Overhead**: Lists contain only IDs, dramatically reducing network traffic and processing load
2. **Reliability**: Granular detail retrieval with per-item error handling
3. **Scalability**: Support for very large lists without performance degradation
4. **Consistency**: Consistent state between successive calls prevents data races
5. **Recovery**: Easy resumption after interruptions with idempotent operations
6. **Rate-Friendly**: Optimized polling frequency reduces API rate limit consumption

### Webhook Alternative (Custom Projects)
For specialized integration requirements, **webhook notifications** are available for custom projects:

- **Event-driven updates**: Immediate notifications for critical state changes
- **Custom endpoints**: Configure your own webhook URLs for real-time updates
- **Selective events**: Choose specific events to subscribe to (order prepared, shipment dispatched, etc.)
- **Retry mechanism**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff for failed webhook deliveries
- **Security**: Webhook signatures for payload verification

<!-- theme: info -->
> **Note**: Webhook functionality requires custom project setup and additional configuration. Contact support@re-store.it for webhook implementation details.

### Polling vs Push

| Aspect | Polling (Standard) | Webhooks (Custom) |
|--------|-------------------|-------------------|
| **Latency** | 5-minute intervals | Near real-time |
| **Reliability** | Very high | High (with fallback) |
| **Setup Complexity** | Simple | Requires custom config |
| **System Load** | Optimized | Event-driven |
| **Cost** | Standard | Custom project pricing |
| **Use Case** | Most integrations | Critical real-time needs |


### Pattern Benefits

1. **Efficiency**: Lists contain only IDs, reducing network traffic
2. **Reliability**: Granular detail retrieval with per-item error handling
3. **Scalability**: Support for very large lists
4. **Consistency**: Consistent state between successive calls
5. **Recovery**: Easy resumption after interruptions



<!-- theme: warning -->
> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: If you find any inconsistencies or errors in this documentation, please report them immediately to support@re-store.it

<!-- theme: info -->
> üí° **Tip**: Always start integration using the Sandbox environment to familiarize yourself with API flows before moving to production.

post.description: Create an item to be managed by the warehouse

/items/{item_code}.summary: Path used to manage a single item.
/items/{item_code}.description: The REST endpoint/path used to get, update, and delete single instances of an `item`.  This path contains `GET`, `PUT`, and `DELETE` operations used to perform the get, update, and delete tasks, respectively.

parameters.name: item_code
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a `item`, URL encoded.

exists.description: true if item/variant exists in Magware

post.description:
Checks whether one or more items/variants exists in Magware.  
Accepts a list of item/variant code and returns their existence status. 
It is intended to validate item presence before performing 
further operations (e.g., inventory updates, order processing, etc.).
Create a new Advanced Shipping Notice that must be received by the warehouse

get.description: Return a list of received ASNs, not yet acquired by Host system

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identification number of a Magware object

get.description: Return information about a received ASN and mark it as acquired by host system

post.description: Create a delivery order that must be fulfilled by the warehouse

get.description: Return a list of prepared deliveries not yet acquired by Host

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identification number of Magware object

get.description: Return detailed information about a prepared delivery order and mark it as acquired by host system
Return a list of cancelled (not fulfilled) deliveries not yet acquired by Host

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identification number of Magware object

get.description: Return information about a cancelled (not fulfilled) delivery order and mark it as acquired by host system

post.description:
Create a shipment for one or more deliveries to the same destination.
This API allows you to unlock the shipment of a delivery when the `ship_on_demand` flag is set to `true`. 

Additionally, it enables the transmission of the delivery note code and date, and related documents in PDF format.

You can also use this API to group multiple deliveries into a single shipment, provided that all deliveries share the same destination, billing details, and shipping conditions.

get.description: Return a list of shipments not yet acquired by Host
Return detailed information about a shipment and mark it as acquired by host system
Return a list of adjustments not yet acquired by Host
Return list of items that currently have stock in the warehouse

parameters.name: item_code
parameters.description: Item code of product to query

get.description: Return current stock of a single item
Usefull for simple testing response from web service

code.description: Code (SKU) of the item. Must be unique for a owner

um.description: Unit of measure of item (tipically selling unit)

warehouse_category.description: Item category defined by warehouse. It can be shared with items of other owners

owner_category.description: Item category defined by the owner. It's a specific categorization define by the owner of the item

variants.description: Variants represent different physical configurations of an item. For example, variants can be used to indicate different packaging of a food product or different sizes of an item of clothing

code.description: Variant code. Must be unique in the item

quantity.description: Indicate the phisical quantity in UoM of the item of the variant. Usually it is 1. If greater than 1 it indicates a variant that contains a multiple of the sales unit (example 12 pieces pack).If less than 1 it indicates products managed in decimal units and the necessary precision (for example a fabric with quantity variant = 0.001 and UoM = m2 indicates that the fabric is managed in m2 with an accuracy of one cm2)

barcodes.description: Array of barcodes that uniquely identify the item and the variant. Must be unique for the owner

volume.description: Variant/package volume in m3. If specified must be greater than 0

weight.description: Gross weight of the variant/package in Kg. If specified must be greater than 0

shippable.description: Indicate that the item package is shippable without need of an external package or re-packaging

shippable_copy.description: Indicate that the item package is shippable without need of an external package or re-packaging

default.description: Indicate that this variant is the default one for the item

quantity_per_package.description: Default quantity per package, expressed in number of whole variants per package.

lot_control.description: Indicate that lot control and tracking is needed for the item

serial_number_control.description: Indicate that serial number control and tracking is needed for the item

expiration_date_control.description: Indicate that expiration date control and tracking is needed for the item

expedition_date_control.description: Indicate that expedition date control and tracking is needed for the item

expedition_days.description: Number of days for expedition date calculation from expiration date

obsolete.description: Indicate that the item is obsolete and no more managed in the future

variable_weight.description: Item with variable weights, for example meat, fish and cheese

can_be_added_to_deliveries.description:
Indicates whether the item can be included as additional, unplanned goods in the deliveries. This field allows the system to flag items that are not originally scheduled for the delivery but can still be added as extras if needed.

- `true`: The item can be added as an extra to the delivery.
- `false`: The item cannot be added as an extra to the delivery.

code.description: ASN identification code, assigned by ERP

supplier.description: Supplier information. If not exists it will be created

contents.description:
Contents of the ASN.
Can be either a list of items or a list of packages that contains multiple items

row_number.description: Row number, unique for an ASN

asn_code.description: ASN identification code, assigned by ERP

row_number.description: Row number, unique for an ASN

lot_number.description: Lot number, if enabled for the item

serial_number.description: Serial number, if enabled for the item

expiration_date.description: Expiration date, if enabled for the item

expedition_date.description: Expedition date, if enabled for the item

address1.description: Name of the street and house number

country.description: 2 digit ISO code of the contry (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

phone.description:
Optional phone number. 
Not mandatory for all deliveries, 
but may be required if using express couriers 
that mandate recipient contact information 
for delivery notifications or coordination.

email.description:
Optional email address. 
Not mandatory for all deliveries, 
but may be required if using express couriers 
that mandate recipient contact information 
for delivery notifications or coordination.

delivery_creation.title: Delivery order creation model
delivery_creation.description: Model for creation of delivery order

code.description: Delivery unique code, assigned by Host system

high_priority.description:
High priority delivery. Deprecated, use instead `priority` value. 
A `true` value set automatically `priority` value to 1000

priority.description:
Urgency level for processing a delivery. 
It determines the order in which deliveries 
should be fulfilled, with higher priority 
values indicating more urgent processing.

partial_allowed.description:
Indicates whether a delivery can be fulfilled 
with a quantity lower than the requested amount. 
If `true`, the system allows partial fulfillment; 
if `false`, the delivery must be completed in full.

reference.description: Reference information for the delivery, returned to Host

row_number.description: Sequential row number. Must be unique for the delivery

stock_type.description: Stock from wich must fulfilled the delivery row

reference.description: Reference information for the row, returned to Host

lot_number.description: Lot number requested for the item

serial_number.description: Serial number requested for the item

expiration_date.description: Expiration date requested for the item

expedition_date.description: Expedition date requested for the item

do_not_pick.description: Indicate that the item must not be picked and delivered

package_type.description: Indicates the package type that must be used to pack the item

do_not_print.description: Indicate that the row must not be printed on the delivery note or other documents

parent_row.description: In case of item is a child of another item, this must indicate the parent `row_number`. If item is a parent of another item, this must be set to zero. For normal row it can be `null` or not present

print_delivery.description: Indicate that warahouse must print and apply the delivery notes

ship_on_demand.description: Warehouse must wait explicit confirmation to ship the delivery

allow_extra_items.description:
A boolean flag that indicates whether additional items can be added to the delivery beyond the originally requested quantity.
- If set to true, the system allows the delivery to include quantities exceeding the customer's initial request.
- If set to false, the delivery must strictly adhere to the requested quantity.

warehouse_annotations.description: Notes specific to the warehouse (text information)

cash_on_delivery.description: Must be present only if Cash On Delivery is requested!

currency.description: 3 digit ISO 4217 Cash On Delivery currency (default: "EUR")

type.description: Cash on delivery type, depend on courier

international_shipment.description: International shipment information, required only for international destination!

currency.description: 3 digit ISO 4217 currency code of the shipment (e.g. EUR, USN, JPY, GBP, ecc)

incoterm.description: Shipment incoterm: DAP, DDP or EXW. For cross borders shipments the default value would be DAP in case it's not specified in the request differently

cancelled.description: Indicates that the delivery was cancelled by the warehouse (i.e. not fulfilled at all)

tracking.description: Tracking information by the courier (if available).

code.description: Tracking code, Ex AWB or Piece ID

date.description: Date when shipment leaves the warehouse

time.description: Time when shipment leaves the warehouse

delivery_code.description: Delivery code as transmitted by host

tracking_code.description: Tracking code generated by the courier (if available). Ex AWB or Piece ID

tracking_link.description: Tracking link generated by the courier

tracking_id.description: Internal Id of tracking system (ex. Gsped ID)

lot_number.description: Lot number, if enabled for the item

serial_number.description: Serial number, if enabled for the item

expiration_date.description: Expiration date, if enabled for the item

expedition_date.description: Expedition date, if enabled for the item

adjustment.title: Adjustment model
adjustment.description: Changing in the inventory of the warehouse

lot_number.description: Lot number, if enabled for the item

serial_number.description: Serial number, if enabled for the item

expiration_date.description: Expiration date, if enabled for the item

expedition_date.description: Expedition date, if enabled for the item

value.description: Custom attribute value. Can be a string, an integer, a boolean or a decimal number

code.description:
Shipment code/number, generated by host system.
Can be, for example, delivery note number

date.description:
Shipment date, generated by host system.
Can be, for example, delivery note date

deliveries.description:
Arrays of deliveries to be included in the shipment.

The deliveries must be in a prepared state, have the ship_on_demand flag set to true, and share the same destination, billing details, and characteristics.

documents.description:
Arrays of documents in PDF format generated for the shipment.

These may include a delivery note, waybill, packing list, invoice, or a combination of these.

courier_code.description:
Optional courier code. 
Can be used to override the currently assigned courier to the deliveries

destination.description:
Optional destination, overriding the destinations specified in deliveries.
If not provided, the shipment defaults to the destination of the first delivery in the `deliveries` array.

currency.description: 3 digit ISO 4217 Cash On Delivery currency (default: "EUR")

type.description: Cash on delivery type, depend on courier

documents.title: documents
documents.description:
Arrays of documents in PDF format.

These may include a delivery note, waybill, packing list, invoice, or a combination of these.

code.description: Code or number of the document

type.description: Type of the document. Example "Delivery notes" or "Invoice"

print.description: Indicate that the document must be printed.

content.description: PDF document, encoded in base64 format

id.name: id
id.description: Unique identification number of Magware object
